title: Social media stocks dip amid GameStop-Reddit frenzy. Why two top names could fall further
text: Facebook shares could fall another 14% if they breach one key level on the stock's chart, Piper Sandler senior technical research analyst Craig Johnson warns.

title: Facebook letting fake news spreaders profit, investigators claim
text: Social network allowing dangerous Covid theories to be shared, says Bureau of Investigative Journalism

title: Forget the furore over Trump - Facebook is interested only in maintaining its monopoly
text: The social network's ‘supreme court' of 40 assorted academics, politicians and journalists to oversee the site's content is little more than a PR exercise

title: Lawmakers want to break up Facebook, but experts say restoring competition through regulation should be the goal (FB)
text: Last week, New York Attorney General Letitia James, who is leading 48 other attorneys general in suing Facebook for illegally stifling competition, told Bloomberg Businessweek that she's considering a breakup of the tech giant as "Facebook's monopoly hurts consumers, it hurts the marketplace, it hurts advertisers." One method, she said, would be to wind down its acquisitions of Instagram and WhatsApp, which Facebook acquired in 2012 and 2014, respectively.  Read more: Wall Street pours cold water on the Facebook breakup party: 'The courts won't buy this.'
